entry.title: Re: My CAP Projects Toolbox
entry.content:
Hi @vvdries , nice post! 

You were looking for some input on the use of the `cds.odata` functions `urlify` and `parse`. While they both don't begin with an underscore (a conventional way of signifying something is off-limits, as I'm sure you know), they are not explicitly documented in Capire* and are therefore deemed to be not for external use. Of course, digging in to the source code and learning about these functions (and how they work, and perhaps more importantly how they also help to clarify the relationship between CQN and the OData protocol adapter, in this example) is great.

*There is one reference, as far as I can find, but it's just in passing and only in a release note entry

HTH!

DJ

entry.title: Re: Error: NoAppDetectedError - An app was not successful...
entry.content:
Are you sure you zipped up the files as described? This message sounds like you might still have the app within the ZIP file ... but within a folder within it. Did you follow the warning in the earlier step, which states:

Be sure not to include the containing folder in the zip file â€“ you must explicitly select only the contents of the cf-sample-app-nodejs-main folder and not that folder itself.

Ensure you don't have a top level enclosing folder in the ZIP file and give it another go. Good luck!

entry.title: The Art and Science of CAP (part 7) with Daniel Hutzel
entry.content:
Back by popular demand! We join Daniel Hutzel again as he continues on his exploration of The Art and Science of CAP, sharing insights and ideas from the origins, philosophy and magic of the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model. #SAPCAP #TASC

See the blog post The Art and Science of CAP for all details, notes, previous episodes, links and more.

entry.title: ðŸ‡³ðŸ‡± SAP CodeJam: Service Integration with CAP ('s-Hertogenbosch, NL)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam introduces attendees to service integration with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Specifically, the Node.js flavor of CAP is used.

During this event, you'll become acquainted with how external services can be integrated and consumed from within a CAP project. In working through the exercises you'll also become comfortable with various facilities that CDS offers for declaring, relating and exposing entities, and familiar with how the SAP Cloud SDK covers connectivity and destinations, supporting such integration scenarios with CAP.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Fri 23 May 2025 in 's-Hertogenbosch, NL. It is being kindly hosted by the lovely folks at newFounders - the CodeJam will take place in their offices. Thanks! 

The instructor is Developer Advocate DJ Adams. 

There are essential prerequisites that must be completed by every attendee, before arriving at the event location. They are documented here: https://github.com/SAP-samples/cap-service-integration-codejam/blob/main/prerequisites.md.

If you wish to attend, please indicate that using the "I'm attending" facility on this page. Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 25 attendees for this event. In that context, if you indicate that you're attending and later realise you can't, please remove your name so that others get a chance instead. Thanks!

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.title: Re: Natallia Shtura
entry.content:
Thanks for the shout-out, Natallia! I'm so glad you got some value from the posts.

For those curious about the content, I have a summarised "table of contents" with links to the individual posts here: https://qmacro.org/blog/posts/2018/01/16/discovering-scp-workflow/

entry.title: Re: Connect with SAP Community at SAP Sapphire and Share Your Special SAP Event Moment!
entry.content:
Gosh, I have many memories from some great SAP events. From attending TechEd in Hamburg in 2000 with my good friend Piers Harding (I'd made a custom tshirt to celebrate R/3 on Linux)

to hanging out with my heroes (here with Brian "BSP" McKellar) at the community lounge at TechEd 2004 in Munich:

to hanging out with fellow SAP Mentors at TechEd 2011 Madrid (including Dick, Twan, Aslan, and very young looking Rich and Tom):

to the celebration board at TechEd Amsterdam in 2013:

to a panel at TechEd Barcelona in 2019:

to a group photo at Inside Track Riga in 2019:

and some of the lovely community folks at TechEd Bengaluru also in 2019 (with my good friend Max):

entry.title: ðŸ‡µðŸ‡± Hands-on with the btp CLI and APIs (WrocÅ‚aw, PL)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam BTP event is on the Core Service APIs for SAP BTP and also the command line interface tool for SAP BTP, otherwise known as the btp CLI.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Fri 06 Jun in WrocÅ‚aw, PL at the WSB Merito University (Building G, Fabryczna 14G, 2nd floor, room 220). The event is kindly being organized by Capgemini Poland and WSB Merito University in WrocÅ‚aw, thank you! Note that this is the day before the SAP Inside Track event on Sat 07 Jun in the same building.

The instructor is Developer Advocate DJ Adams.

There are essential prerequisites that must be completed by every attendee, before arriving at the event location. They are documented here: https://github.com/SAP-samples/cloud-btp-cli-api-codejam/blob/main/prerequisites.md 

If you wish to attend, please indicate that using the "I'm attending" facility on this page. Please note that spaces are limited to a maximum of 35 participants. If you indicate that you're attending, and later realise you're unable to, please remove your name so that others get a chance instead. Thanks!

For more information on SAP CodeJam BTP events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.title: Re: Task 0 - Server and service provisioning (July Developer Challenge - "Reverse APIs")
entry.content: Hello Hemanth - did you watch the video that covers this (link at the top of this thread), and did you follow the steps? If so, and you're still getting an error, you'll need to help us to help you, by giving much more detail here. What did you do? What are the details? What about screenshots? What else did you try? Thanks. DJ

entry.title: Re: The Complete Guide to Calling Actions in UI5 with Custom Code
entry.content:
Great post Marian, thanks for sharing.

(The following is a rather minor subject, I don't want to detract from the great details you share!)

I noticed the examples you gave for actions and functions; the topic is always interesting to me and I would like to use this opportunity to ask the readers for their additional examples. I do this because I am of the mind that "Post an order" (quoted above as an example of an action) is something I would personally prefer or expect to see as a regular OData "create" operation (via HTTP POST), and "Generate report" (quoted above as another example of an action) feels more like it should be a (side-effect-free) function, that could then be called via HTTP GET (and enjoy cacheing if appropriate) rather than the semantically heavy HTTP POST (which is required for any action).

I'd love to hear from folks - what are your fav examples?

Thanks
DJ

entry.title: ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ SAP Fiori elements flexible programming model (Birmingham, UK)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is about the SAP Fiori elements flexible programming model (FPM). After a quick introduction to UI5, we will dive in and learn how to build a web application that allows users to browse and order books. Using the FPM, we will customise this SAP Fiori elements application.

The content for this SAP CodeJam is available on GitHub: https://github.com/SAP-samples/fiori-elements-fpm-exercises-codejam

Like all CodeJams, this is a hands-on experience. For any beginners, we will make time to guide you through the exercises. For all participants it is essential that you complete the prerequisites which are described in Step 1 of Chapter 00 of the content; if you're not sure which option to take, we recommend option 1 which is to create a trial account on the SAP Business Technology Platform and check that you can access the Business Application Studio; there are links to tutorials on both these steps.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Wed 08 Oct 2025 from 09:30 - 15:30 local time in Birmingham, UK at the offices of Shoosmiths (103 Colmore Row, Birmingham, England B3 3AG) who are graciously making both space and lunch available for us, thank you.

The instructor will be Developer Advocate Nico Schoenteich, assisted by Developer Advocate DJ Adams.

Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 25 attendees. Please also note that this CodeJam is being organised by UKISUG and you must register for participation on their website (not here) - head over to https://www.sapusers.org/event-calendar/sap-fiori-elements-flexible-programming-model-codejam.html (if you're not a UKISUG member, you can register as a guest; you don't need to be a UKISUG member to attend).

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.title: Re: Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt ðŸ”¨ðŸª™ ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Nice ðŸ™‚

Setting `YTINFO` to the value from example mission 1, `COLOUR` to the value from example mission 2 and `NRFOUNDERS` to the value for the number of founders, I decided to run this pleasantly convoluted command sequence to produce the answer, because why not ðŸ˜»

echo -e "$( \                                           
  echo -e "obase=16\nibase=16\n${YTINFO}${COLOUR} * ${NRFOUNDERS}" \
  | bc \
  | sed 's/\(..\)/\\x\1/g' \
)"

entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam introduces attendees to service integration with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Specifically, the Node.js flavor of CAP is used.

During this event, you'll become acquainted with how external services can be integrated and consumed from within a CAP project. In working through the exercises you'll also become comfortable with various facilities that CDS offers for declaring, relating and exposing entities, and familiar with how the SAP Cloud SDK covers connectivity and destinations, supporting such integration scenarios with CAP.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Fri 10 Oct 2025 in Munich, DE. It is being kindly hosted at SAP Labs Munich, in Garching. It takes place the day before SAP Inside Track Munich.

Note that the building has changed from MUE03 to MUE04.

The instructor is Developer Advocate DJ Adams. 

There are essential prerequisites that must be completed by every attendee, before arriving at the event location. They are documented here: https://github.com/SAP-samples/cap-service-integration-codejam/blob/main/prerequisites.md.

entry.content: In this fireside chat, weâ€™ll cut through the noise to explore how AI agents can deliver real business value. Weâ€™ll share firsthand insights from recent customer engagements and AI Agent Discovery and Design workshops, revealing what it takes to move from talking about AI Agents to deployment.
